description.plain:
Founded in 1979, The Sequence was an American female hip-hop group trio based in Columbia, South Carolina.

They are noted as the first female hip-hop trio to sign with the Sugar Hill label. The group consisted of three school friends – lead singer/rapper Angie Brown Stone, known as “Angie B.”, Gwendolyn Chisolm, known as “Blondie”, and Cheryl Cook, known as “Cheryl The Pearl”.

Their most notable single was “Funk You Up” released in 1979, which was known to be the first rap record released by a female group.

songs.title: Funk You Up

description.plain:
This song is notable for being the first hip-hop release from a female rap group, and also for following the seminal “Rapper’s Delight” as the second single on the label Sugar Hill.

This song has been sampled and referenced in several songs, including Dr. Dre’s “Keep Their Heads Ringin'”, and Mark Ronson’s “Uptown Funk”.
